verses.text: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar shall be square, and its height shall be three cubits.
verses.comment: Maintains measurements as in Hebrew, 'acacia wood' per common translation.

verses.text: You shall make horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.
verses.comment: ‘Horns’ are literal projections at the corners, materials clarified.

verses.text: You shall make its pots to take away its ashes, and its shovels and its basins and its forks and its firepans. You shall make all its utensils of bronze.
verses.comment: Each implement is named as in original; 'forks' can mean meat hooks.

verses.text: You shall make a grate of bronze netting for it, and on the net you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
verses.comment: ‘Grate of bronze netting’ is a direct match for Hebrew description.

verses.text: And you shall put it under the ledge of the altar below, so that the net will reach halfway up the altar.
verses.comment: Placement and use of the bronze grate described per original.

verses.text: And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
verses.comment: Material and overlay specified plainly.

verses.text: The poles shall be put into the rings, so that the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar for carrying it.
verses.comment: Clear, literal description of how the altar is to be carried.

verses.text: You shall make it hollow, with boards. As it was shown to you on the mountain, so shall they make it.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; ‘shown to you’ references Moses’ vision.

verses.text: You shall make the courtyard of the tabernacle. On the south side the courtyard shall have hangings of fine twisted linen one hundred cubits long for that side.
verses.comment: Material and measurements kept as in original.

verses.text: Its twenty pillars and their twenty bronze sockets shall have hooks of silver and their bands of silver.
verses.comment: Literal rendering; ‘bands’ can also mean connecting rods or fillets.

verses.text: Likewise for the north side, there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, with twenty pillars and twenty bronze sockets; the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
verses.comment: Direct repetition, as in Hebrew text.

verses.text: On the west side there shall be hangings fifty cubits wide, with ten pillars and ten sockets.
verses.comment: West side’s reduced length specified.

verses.text: The width of the courtyard on the east side shall be fifty cubits.
verses.comment: Measurement clarified as width, matching the original.

verses.text: The hangings for one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits, with three pillars and three sockets.
verses.comment: Each side of the gate described as in original text.

verses.text: And for the other side, hangings of fifteen cubits, with three pillars and three sockets.
verses.comment: Mirrors previous verse, specifying symmetry.

verses.text: For the gate of the courtyard there shall be a screen twenty cubits long, of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and fine twisted linen, embroidered with needlework. It shall have four pillars and four sockets.
verses.comment: Colors and materials maintained distinctly.

verses.text: All the pillars around the courtyard shall have bands of silver; their hooks shall be of silver and their sockets of bronze.
verses.comment: Material and construction detailed as in original.

verses.text: The length of the courtyard shall be one hundred cubits, the width fifty cubits, and the height five cubits, with hangings of fine twisted linen and sockets of bronze.
verses.comment: Summary of the courtyard’s overall dimensions and materials.

verses.text: All the utensils of the tabernacle for every use, all its pegs, and all the pegs for the courtyard, shall be of bronze.
verses.comment: ‘Pegs’ are literal tent pegs; all made of bronze.

verses.text: You shall command the children of Israel to bring you pure beaten olive oil for the lamp, to make it burn continuously.
verses.comment: ‘Pure beaten olive oil’ is literal and accurate to the Hebrew.

verses.text: In the tent of meeting, outside the veil that is by the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall arrange it from evening until morning before the LORD. This shall be a statute forever for the children of Israel throughout their generations.
verses.comment: ‘Arrange it’ refers to tending the lamp; ‘statute forever’ is a literal phrase.
